name: places/ChIJeYF3yaVZwokR9TLyqkCAaDY
formattedAddress: 24 W 26th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 24 W 26th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store with new & gently used clothing, shoes & accessories, including brand-name items.

originalText.text: Brought a large suitcase filled with clothes. The employee took a 10-15minute glance for them to say that my clothes were worth nothing. Even though I had 10 pairs of men's jeans all with trendy designs, a handful of satin Van Heusen collard shirts, and plenty of brand shirts like Adidas, Timberland, etc, 10 trendy over-clothes vests for a grunge style and a GOOD quality & thick blazer. Spent 2 hours sorting through clothes and made sure I only put quality, name brand clothes. It felt like they were lazy & a little discriminatory. I was recommended to this place by friends and was told they were able to sell only a  handful of clothes for more money than I got when I brought a suitcase. But this is america, what can I do but leave a review and never go back. Ended up having to give away the clothes to Salvation army, what a waste but glad people will wear the clothes for free at least.

originalText.text: I was hard pressed to find anything I liked in this store. Normally in vintage and thrift stores I find loads of items I like. This seems to cater to a very specific crowd. Took a whole bag of items, but not surprisingly they only ended up taking two items.  Get store credit it's more than cash payout. Luckily I did find a sweater. Not really worth the wait/time. Don't go out of your way to come here imo

originalText.text: Great experience with the company today. All the stores gave theri signature smell. Kid friendly environment. Pet friendly environment. Wheelchair accessible location. Conveniently located near mass transit.

text.text: Great experience with the company today. All the stores gave theri signature smell. Kid friendly environment. Pet friendly environment. Wheelchair accessible location. Conveniently located near mass transit.

originalText.text: I never write reviews but my experience here was so crazy that I had to. I cant urge people enough not to go here. My boyfriend went in for me with almost brand new, expensive, on trend pieces. The sales associate offered him $35 for 5 of my pieces… I was genuinely in shock. My boyfriend kindly said no and asked for the pieces back. I told my boyfriend before he left to check (I had read another review about them trying to steal) and I’m glad he did because they tried it on him. He noticed one of my blazers was missing and when he went in to ask for it, the associate played dumb and said rudely “oh I thought you were selling it”. The sales associate literally took, tagged and hid one of my pieces. Keep in mind, he never paid my boyfriend for it and even told him to have a nice day when he left initially. Absolute thieves - don’t waste your time.

originalText.text:
I recently tried out the Sell by Mail service offered by Crossroads Trading. While I appreciate the effort they put into evaluating my items, I was genuinely surprised and disappointed that none of my items were selected for purchase. Notably, many of these were in pristine condition, with some even brand new and still tagged.

The clarity in their selection criteria left me puzzled. A more detailed explanation or feedback system would be immensely helpful for users to understand their standards and make better decisions for future submissions.

Additionally, I learned post-evaluation that unselected items are donated. While this might be a noble initiative, I believe customers should retain the choice, especially if they have a preferred charity or would like to manage donations personally. Although I've conveyed my preference to have my items returned and am willing to cover any associated costs, this experience made me question the transparency of the service.

In all honesty, I'm left feeling dissatisfied with this experience. As feedback is the cornerstone of improvement, I hope Crossroads Trading considers this review as an opportunity for reflection and enhancement. It's unlikely I'll be using or recommending their Sell by Mail service again in its current state.

SUCKS!
